abstract: A new group is seeking to inject the patients’ right to control their own health data into the Obama administration’s drive to computerize medical records.
snippet: A new group is seeking to inject the patients’ right to control their own health data into the Obama administration’s drive to computerize medical records.
lead_paragraph: Starting with a few dozen supporters, including health bloggers, individual physicians, startups and Microsoft, a group is seeking to firmly inject the rights of patients into the Obama administration’s multibillion-dollar drive to computerize medical records.

headline.main: A Push for the Wired Patient’s Bill of Rights

abstract: Microsoft co-founder Paul Allen is back in the consumer software game, with the introduction of Xiant, a start-up designed to help users organize their Outlook e-mail.
snippet: Microsoft co-founder Paul Allen is back in the consumer software game, with the introduction of Xiant, a start-up designed to help users organize their Outlook e-mail.
lead_paragraph: Microsoft co-founder Paul Allen is back in the consumer software game, with the start of Xiant, which is designed to help users organize their Outlook e-mail messages.

headline.main: Paul Allen Launches Xiant, an Outlook Organizer
